availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James H. Hawes (Johnson County, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Johnson County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Floyd County, Kentucky, native. Married to Serrilda Remy Hawes on February 10, 1852. Father of William Hawes, Mary J. Hawes, Samuel Hawes, Francis M. Hawes, John Jay Hawes, Lucy E. Hawes, and George W. Hawes. Farmer in Johnson County in 1850. Farmer in Johnson County in 1860. Corporal in the 65th Regiment of Kentucky Militia (U.S.A.) from May 21, 1864, to June 21, 1864.
